Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Api Ib K10P12T13 (Apidaecin IB K10,P12,T13 variant, Pro-rich, PrAMPs, synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: expression library screen, amino acid substitution, insects, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (84.21%) toApidaecin IBP: 33%, R=N: 11%.Activity: it inhibited E. coli BL21 (MIC 1-64 uM) in different media RPMI/serum or TSB or LB. Activity in LB < RPMI < TSB. It appears that this Pro-rich peptide is more active in the TSB medium. Warning: Other bacteria not tested.
